sentences.english: No one knows why, but the fell from grace with the boss.
sentences.chinese: 谁也不知为什么，他竟失宠于上司。

sentences.english: I bought my mom a new pet, so the old cat will break its shovel.
sentences.chinese: 我给妈妈买了只新宠物，那只老猫要失宠了。

sentences.english: Vanity keeps people in favor of themselves who are out of favor with all others.
sentences.chinese: 虚荣使人得宠于己，而失宠于人。

sentences.english: This is not to say that Mr. St-Pierre’s appeal is lost on women.
sentences.chinese: 这其实也说明不了圣皮埃尔先生在女人堆里失宠了。

sentences.english: He was an advisor to Nero until he fell out of favor, and Nero kicked him out and all that sort of thing.
sentences.chinese: 失宠之前是尼禄大帝的顾问，后来尼禄把他赶走。

sentences.english: He had been the king's favourite, and his sudden fall from grace surprised everyone.
sentences.chinese: 他本是国王的幸臣，一朝失宠众人无不感到意外。

sentences.english: Having lapsed from grace, he tried every means to win back favour again.
sentences.chinese: 失宠之后，他千方百计重新赢得欢心。

definition: to snub/to consign to the trash heap of history
(old) (esp. of the Emperor) to show special favor towards
(in literature and opera) a place to which a monarch banishes a wife or concubine who falls from favor/(fig.) the doghouse/a state of disfavor
desolate/unfrequented/to treat sb coldly/to snub/to cold shoulder
to overthrow/downfall/to fall from power/to go bankrupt
to commit suicide on the orders of a sovereign (old)
title of respect for the queen mother or the emperor's father/nickname for Empress Dowager Cixi 慈禧太后[Ci2 xi3 tai4 hou4]
